message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.AI, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with optimization of spectrum sensing and scheduling in cognitive radio networks, which involves techniques from information theory (cs.IT) for compressed sensing and sparse recovery, networking (cs.NI) for resource allocation and scheduling, control systems (cs.SY) for the design of a central controller, artificial intelligence (cs.AI) for the optimization problem formulation, and machine learning (cs.LG) for the belief representation and myopic scheduling strategy.
